value.title: Exploring the Visio visual in Power BI
value.excerpt: Want to explore locations with data? The Visio visual in Power BI helps you do just that! Patrick looks at how to set it up and help use your data to highlight areas within a Visio diagram.  Download Sample: https://guyinacu.be/visiosample  Documentation: https://support.microsoft.com/office/add-visio-visuals-to-power-bi-reports-4f09be62-f436-45c2-93b0-4a0f66b1f5a7

value.title: Filter Power BI reports using a URL query string
value.excerpt: In this video, I show you how to filter Power BI reports, within the Power BI service, using a URL query string.  This is actually documented here - https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/powerbi-service-share-unshare-dashboard/#share-just-a-report  In addition to showing you how to filter

value.title: How Parameters work with the Power BI Paginated Visual
value.excerpt: Parameters for the Power BI Paginated visual can give you a lot of flexibility. Adam walks you through how to set up the parameters and breaks down what is actually happening with the values.  Create and use the paginated report visual https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/visuals/paginated-report-visual

value.title: No Calendar Table? How to add Fiscal Month and Sort in Power BI?

value.title: Power BI Tutorial: 4 Ways To Get Data
value.excerpt: In this Power BI tutorial, Adam looks at 4 ways to get data in Power BI. This focuses on Power BI Desktop and the main storage modes - Import, DirectQuery and Live Connections to Analysis Services. If you are new to Power BI, be sure to check out this Power BI Tutorial: 4 ways to get data.   Import (Excel)

value.title: Slicers vs. Slicer Pane vs. Filter Pane! Which is faster?
value.excerpt: You have different options in Power BI when it comes to slicers and filters. Just put the slicer on the report, use a slicer panel or have them in the filter pane. But which one is faster??? Patrick explores a few scenarios to think about!  Should you hide the filter pane in Power BI? https://greyskullanalytics.com/should-you-hide-the-filter-pane-in-power-bi/

value.title: The Power BI Smart Narrative visual is INSANE AMAZING!
value.excerpt: The smart narrative visual can help tell the story in your Power BI report. Justyna Lucznik joins us to explore the visual and to illustrate how you can generate text about your data.  Make sure you have the September 2020 version of Power BI Desktop, or later.  Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/visuals/power-bi-visualization-smart-narrative

value.title: Tracing with Log Analytics and Power BI
value.excerpt: With Log Analytics integration in Power BI, you can now capture Analysis Services trace events easily and over a longer period of time. Combined with the Power BI template report, you can gain a lot of insights into usage of your datasets. With more to come down the road!  Announcing long-term usage

value.title: Using Images from a Database in Power BI
value.excerpt: We've looked at images from sources like OneDrive and the web with your Power BI reports. What about from a database? Is that possible? Patrick takes a look at how you can do it.  SQLJason Blog:  http://sqljason.com/2018/01/embedding-images-in-power-bi-using-base64.html  Gerhard's Blog: https://blog.gbrueckl.at/2018/01/storing-images-powerbi-analysis-services-data-models/
